title.narrative: Support to MEC on Anti Corruption to Afghanistan (MEC)

description.narrative: The Independent Joint Anti-Corruption Monitoring and Evaluation Committee (MEC) is constituted by decree of the President of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan. The mandate of the Committee is to develop Anti-Corruption recommendations and benchmarks; and to monitor and evaluate the government and international community`s efforts to fight corruption. There are 6 committee members i.e. 3 Afghans and 3 International. The activities of the Committee are supported by a permanent Secretariat of twenty-five full-time-equivalents comprised of national and international experts, advisors, and officers, among others. Members of the Committee are selected by the international community and the Afghan government and are responsible for setting priorities, and directing the Executive Director of its permanent Secretariat. Denmark is suppporting MEC since it etablsihment in 2012 till date with the total amount of DKK 15 million.
